text:
Hi there!
I'm new developing to HubSpot. I am trying to create a "hello world" (a test app only) and list in HubSpot Marketplace. It would be something like a button in contact to send a message or something like that, but I could not find anything explaning how to do that. The only thing I found was how to connect/authenticate my app to HubSpot.

Could any of you help here?
Thanks
Hi there, is there a easy to understand css documentation / reference on how to style embedded hs forms on external sites? What classes are available and what are they doing?
One options is to use “CRM Cards”. You could attach one to the Contact object. They have “actions” that allow you to `POST` to URLs.

<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/crm-extensions/crm-extensions-overview>
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/extensions/custom-cards>
<#C2YHAHB6K|api> might be a good channel, too.
that's the way I want to look the form like

Hi everyone - I don't see where's a good place to ask:
I*s anyone doing analysis of user activity in another tool?*
HubSpot's reports are pretty good, but ideally I'd like to have everything in a database so I can do my own analysis and easily tie it to other data sources.

I'm curious if this is a CMS Bug that anyone else is experiencing.  Basically, when trying to switch to a different theme template, it doesn't work. The page remains with the same content from the original template selected when creating the page.

In this test, I created a page and selected a theme template. I didn't touch any of the content or add any new module. Just selected a different template.

<https://www.loom.com/share/ae16b0a4d1a94140b4fd408ace2dda27>
Hey hey Kevin isn't it the fact that the modules are being inserted into the new template The Way they were in the old template as well?
Assuming that the templates are using the same base and they have essentially the same dnd area

<@U38EZFVFE> I saw your comments.  Yes the template are using the same base.  I guess the expected behavior when switching to a different theme template to have all the modules associated to that template switch out as well.  I know it gets tricky with the DND areas.  Just a confusing UX.  I had a customer want to "try out" a few templates when creating a page and didn't understand why he couldn't switch between the different ones.

I assume if you give dnd_areas unique names across templates this wont happen.
```{% dnd_area "unique_name", class="main" %}```
An assumption though.
Anything/ modules hardcoded inside that at the template level I assume are meant to be “defaults”
I think the system looks for areas where is can be inserted regardless of name.. asuming the name is diffreent on the templare

Will give it a try at some point - however, this does raise something that would be a cool feature request - the ability during development (with hs watch) to override what has been site in the page editor. As this functionality is a bit of a pain when developing a new theme
similar to when you are staging a page
Thanks for the tip <@UQERM7BLY>!
<@UQERM7BLY> and <@U38EZFVFE>... I tried it.  Chad, you were right. Adding a `unique_name` to the dnd_area didn't have an impact and switching to a new theme template.
yeah sorry that im right dude.
:neutral_face:
Thanks Mitja, i have solved the issue with the HubDB approach as you suggested. Thanks alot!!
